str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Tomorrow. From epi and aurion; occurring on the succeeding day, i.e. to-morrow.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Feminine Singular

str2: (a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
The day of preparation, the day before the Sabbath, Friday. As if from paraskeuazo; readiness.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
High priest, chief priest. From arche and hiereus; the high-priest; by extension a chief priest.
Of Hebrew origin; a separatist, i.e. Exclusively religious; a Pharisean, i.e. Jewish sectary.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From sun and ago; to lead together, i.e. Collect or convene; specially, to entertain.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
Pilate. Of Latin origin; close-pressed, i.e. Firm; Pilatus, a Roman.
